channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024021397
item.description:
Report X-2024021397

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED METAL DRUM NOTICEABLY WET. CONTENTS OF 1 X 5 GALLON METAL PAIL "UN1263 PAINT" (FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS), FAILED AT TOP LID. LEAKAGE OF CONTENTS CAUSING ENTIRE PACKAGE TO FAIL. DEEMED DAMAGED AND UNUSABLE GOODS. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP LID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report X-2024021271
item.description:
Report X-2024021271

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-03
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 3rd a package was found during the AM sort that was leaking. The package contained 1805, Phosphoric acid, solution, 8, III, the inner glass receptacle broke, causing the entire contents to leak. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and will be sent for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024021396
item.description:
Report X-2024021396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE. CONTENTS DEEMED AS; 2 X 1 US GALLON CANS OF RESIN SOLUTION (UN1866). PACKAGE DID NOT HAVE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL, AND FAILED AT TOP LID. INTERNAL LEAKAGE FAILED PACKAGE ENTIRELY. PAINT CANS ARE DENTED, DAMAGED AND UNUSABLE GOODS. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP LID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report X-2024021312
item.description:
Report X-2024021312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: MARION
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SIX PKGS ARRIVED ALL WITH SAME TRACKING NUMBER. AUDITOR CONTACTED HMSC AND CONFIRMED UNDECLARED. NON-LEAKING PACKAGE WITH NO DAMAGE DETERMINED TO BE AN UNDECLARED COMFIRM WITH HMSC. YOU COULD PARTIALLY SEE NOVELTY FIREWORKS IN HOLES IN THE BANANA BOXES BEING USED. THE CENTER REMOVED THE BROWN TAPE ON A COUPLE OF THE BOXES AND THERE IS A PARTIAL NOVELTY STATEMENT ON THE THERMAL LABELS.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found box in red hazmat tub during daily hazmat cage inspection DescribePack: top caps on bottles came loose/broke causing liquid to leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: box and bottles placed in red hazmat tub with plastic bag to catch any liquid

item.title: Report X-2024021178
item.description:
Report X-2024021178

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED CLOSURES OPEN, INTERNAL LEAKAGE, AND CONTENTS BROKEN. CONTENTS DEEMED AS 1 X 1 GALLON (GLASS BOTTLE) OF ACETONE UN1090, FAILING ENTIRELY DUE TO BROKEN GLASS BOTTLE. NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL, GLASS BOTTLE PLACED INSIDE OF PLASTIC BAG THAT WAS ZIPPED TIED. ENTIRE PACKAGE DEEMED AS, DAMAGED AND UNUSABLE GOODS. DescribePack: FAILED AT BODY. GLASS BOTTLE CRACKED ENTIRELY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.
